channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Spike in dengue cases has not overburdened health system
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

A spike in dengue fever cases in recent months has not placed an undue burden on Singapore's healthcare system, said the Health Ministry's director of medical services Kenneth Mak yesterday.

item.title: AI platform aids treatment for relapsed lymphoma
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

After six years of being cancer-free, Madam Peggy Tay, 71, was distraught to find out in January last year that her lymphoma - a cancer that attacks infection-fighting white blood cells - had returned.

item.title: No known case here of Covid-19 reinfection, but ministry on lookout
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Nobody in Singapore is known to have been infected with Covid-19 a second time, but this is something the authorities are monitoring very closely.

item.title: Bukit Panjang transport hub emerges as new cluster
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

One of the three Covid-19 community cases announced yesterday was linked to three previous cases, forming a new cluster at Bukit Panjang Integrated Transport Hub.

item.title: Your doctor will see you now - online
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Ms Greta Susan d'Rozario is 86 and she recently completed two video-call consultations with her doctors last month.

item.title: 4 in 10 cases carried on with activities after onset of symptoms
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Four in 10 confirmed Covid-19 cases here continued to engage in community activities after the onset of symptoms.

item.title: Partner in Eng's wonton mee business sues founder's son
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The son of the founder of the famed Eng's wonton noodles is back again in court, in the latest chapter of a soured relationship with a business partner. This time, Mr Desmond Ng is being sued by the business partner, Ms Pauline New, over an alleged conspiracy to "injure" their company, Eng's Noodles House, and cause it to suffer losses.

item.title: HDB flat resale volume plunges 41.9% in Q2
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Housing Board flat resale transactions plunged in the second quarter of this year in the light of the circuit breaker measures.

item.title: Risk factors for infection
Intensive vector control exercise to combat dengue
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

To combat the unprecedented dengue outbreak this year, the National Environment Agency (NEA) will be working with town councils on a two-week intensive islandwide vector control exercise, the agency announced yesterday.

item.title: Swab operations carried out to ring-fence cases as early as possible
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 1,300 workers from Keppel Shipyard and Northpoint City were tested after the sites emerged as workplace clusters, and two positive cases were uncovered through these swab operations.

item.title: Last five charged over unlawful Sengkang gathering of 18 people
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The last five of the 18 people who were allegedly part of an unlawful gathering in Sengkang during the circuit breaker appeared in a district court yesterday.

item.title: Firms laying off staff must keep S'porean core: NTUC
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The labour movement yesterday asked firms to ensure that workers affected by retrenchments were treated fairly and the Singaporean core of the workforce kept intact.

item.title: All worker dorms expected to be cleared of Covid-19 by Aug 7
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

All migrant worker dormitories are expected to be cleared of Covid-19 by Aug 7 except for 17 standalone blocks in purpose-built facilities, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: Uniquely Singapore products to mark nation's birthday
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Veteran pastry chef Ana Fong fondly remembers sharing one of her family business' past specialities - a hybrid between a cake and a pastry - with her siblings when she was a child.

item.title: Stricter Covid control measures at popular spots
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Popular public spots such as beaches and bars will see enhanced crowd controls and stricter enforcement against those who flout safe management rules, the task force on Covid-19 said yesterday.

item.title: No go for weekend getaways in Malaysia any time soon
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans are unlikely to be able to go on weekend holidays in Malaysia any time soon as travel requirements between both countries will remain stringent, said Health Minister Gan Kim Yong.

item.title: Virtual National Day Istana Open House on Aug 2 open to everyone
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Day Istana Open House will be held online this year, with visitors getting a tour of rarely-seen features such as an air-raid shelter located in a cellar.

item.title: LTA ex-senior director in $1.2m graft case
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

A former deputy group director of the Land Transport Authority (LTA) was yesterday charged with corruption involving $1.24 million in loans from contractors and sub-contractors.

item.title: Time lag to resume work expected for workers cleared of coronavirus
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Not all migrant workers cleared of Covid-19 will be able to return to work immediately.

item.title: Common core curriculum for new NTU students from 2021
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

From August next year, undergraduates entering Nanyang Technological University (NTU) will have to take up a common core curriculum that will enable them to make connections across disciplines and develop interdisciplinary knowledge and skills.

item.title: CEO and project director at one of Singapore's major construction groups among the accused
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Prominent Singaporean businessmen Pek Lian Guan and Pay Teow Heng of Tiong Seng Holdings have been accused of bribing former Land Transport Authority deputy group director Henry Foo Yung Thye in order to advance their company's business interests.

item.title: In Brief : Keep masks on at cinemas
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Keep masks on at cinemas

item.title: Water odour: PUB to study enhancement of treatment processes
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

National water agency PUB will look into enhancing treatment processes after some households in Pasir Ris, Yishun and Tampines reported on Wednesday that boiled tap water gave off a pandan smell.

item.title: Principles in NTUC's framework will help guide firms: Observers
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The principles in the labour movement's proposed fair retrenchment framework are not new but they will help guide firms when layoffs become inevitable, observers said.

item.title: Pooled tests can be used in dorms, community
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Pooled testing can reduce the use of resources, and this strategy can be used in settings where the Covid-19 prevalence is low as well as higher-risk areas like dormitories, said the Health Ministry's director of medical services Kenneth Mak.

item.title: Family settles suit over near-drowning at Civil Service Club
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The parents of a boy, who was seven when he was severely disabled in a swimming pool accident in 2015, have settled their lawsuit against the Civil Service Club for an undisclosed sum.

item.title: First half of special Workfare payout from Tuesday
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Around 400,000 lower-wage Singaporeans will be receiving $1,500 from Tuesday, their first payout of the Workfare Special Payment.

item.title: Sufficient vaccine doses perhaps only in end-2021
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Sufficient doses of a Covid-19 vaccine may be available only towards the end of next year, the Ministry of Health's director of medical services Kenneth Mak has said.

item.title: Licences suspended for 10 who sold cigarettes to underage buyers
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Ten tobacco retailers who sold cigarettes to people under the minimum legal age had their licences suspended by the authorities.

item.title: Rules, enforcement at popular spots tightened
item.description:
July 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Five weeks into phase two of Singapore's reopening, lapses into old habits and weak links have prompted a retightening of safety and enforcement measures at hot spots to prevent a spike in new Covid-19 infections, the authorities said.

item.title: Man and woman to be charged with murder of woman's 4-year-old daughter
item.description:
July 25, 2020 1:27 AM

SINGAPORE - A 33-year-old man and a 25-year-old woman are expected to be charged on Saturday (July 25) with the murder of the woman's four-year-old daughter.
